page.title: 05PENZANCE PUBLIC LIBRARY.
page.content: The Penzance Public Library has two sections.They are called the{lending library and the{reference}library.The oldest book in the library is a Cornish book which is 200 years old. There are about 41699 books in the library. The best liked authors are Cathrine Cookson and Winston Graham. The most expensive book is a set called "Groves Dictionaries of Music". The library gets lots of holiday- makers in the summer, and about{4500 {people a week}.The rarest books they have in the library are Cornish books. Apart from books in the library they have records.They have large-print books for partially-sighted people.The largest books in the library are the atlases.The biggest is about 50cm long and 27cm wide. There is a library van which goes around the places further away from the town. Alv.
